raid7proxyMibVersion.name: raid7proxyMibVersion
raid7proxyMibVersion.description: The version of this proxy MIB.

raid7proxyAgentVersion.name: raid7proxyAgentVersion
raid7proxyAgentVersion.description: The version of the Proxy Agent software

raid7CacheLifetime.name: raid7CacheLifetime
raid7CacheLifetime.description: The time in seconds that the agent will treat a value from the RAID7 as valid. When this time is exceeded for any object, the value of that object will be considered invalid and will return GenError (NoSuchObject will be returned only for oids that are never valid).

raid7CacheTimeouts.name: raid7CacheTimeouts
raid7CacheTimeouts.description: The number of times that an error has been returned for an SNMP operation because the raid7CacheLifetime has been exceeded for some object.

raid7BadValues.name: raid7BadValues
raid7BadValues.description: This counts the number of times that the agent has discarded a data value from the RAID7 because it was out of range. This may indicate a version incompatibility between the agent and the array, or a serial link problem.

raid7LinkName.name: raid7LinkName
raid7LinkName.description: The device name on the proxy agent platform for the link between the proxy agent and the RAID7.

raid7LinkStatus.name: raid7LinkStatus
raid7LinkStatus.description: This object indicates the status of the serial link to the RAID7: operational indicates that the device is open and frames are being received from the RAID7. openfailed indicates that there is a problem local to the agent that is preventing the agent process from opening; see the log file on the agent system. quiet indicates that the port was opened, but no data is being received from the RAID7.

raid7LinkUp.name: raid7LinkUp
raid7LinkUp.description: This trap is sent whenever the link becomes operational.

raid7LinkDown.name: raid7LinkDown
raid7LinkDown.description: This trap is sent whenever the link status changes from operational to quiet.

raid7LinkInactivityTime.name: raid7LinkInactivityTime
raid7LinkInactivityTime.description: The number of seconds allowed between characters received from the RAID7 before the raid7LinkStatus is changed to quiet.

raid7LinkRcvBytes.name: raid7LinkRcvBytes
raid7LinkRcvBytes.description: Number of bytes received from the RAID7; this includes those bytes later discarded due to errors, and counts both bytes of an escaped value sequence.

raid7LinkXmtBytes.name: raid7LinkXmtBytes
raid7LinkXmtBytes.description: Number of bytes sent to the RAID7; this counts both bytes of an escaped value sequence.

raid7LinkRcvFrames.name: raid7LinkRcvFrames
raid7LinkRcvFrames.description: Number of frames recognized from the RAID7; this includes those frames later discarded due to errors counted below.

raid7LinkXmtFrames.name: raid7LinkXmtFrames
raid7LinkXmtFrames.description: Number of framees sent to the RAID7.

raid7LinkFramingErrors.name: raid7LinkFramingErrors
raid7LinkFramingErrors.description: This counts frames from the RAID7 discarded by the agent because the length received did not match the message length field in the header.

raid7LinkChecksumErrors.name: raid7LinkChecksumErrors
raid7LinkChecksumErrors.description: This counts frames from the RAID7 discarded by the agent because the checksum was not correct.

raid7LinkBadVersions.name: raid7LinkBadVersions
raid7LinkBadVersions.description: This counts frames from the RAID7 discarded by the agent because the protocol version number in the header was not a version supported by the proxy software.

raid7LinkBadIds.name: raid7LinkBadIds
raid7LinkBadIds.description: This counts frames from the RAID7 discarded by the agent because the type/class/group header field was not a value supported by the proxy software.

raid7LinkBadInstances.name: raid7LinkBadInstances
raid7LinkBadInstances.description: This counts frames from the RAID7 discarded by the agent because the instance header field was out of range.
